author: CoolGoose
message: I really like the polishing work and it would be great if other developers would be inspired by you to let's say dedicated a cycle only for polishing work.

author: xpete
message:
Where there's a "Close" button on the bottom right? I think It's useless as there's already a close button on the title bar.
Why you removed the "Stop" button?... I think It should be there.
Maybe you can place the "Search" and "Stop" button on the left side of the "Clear" Button.

replies.author: xpete
replies.message: Sorry, I mean why there's a "Close button on the bottom right?

replies.author: Znurre
replies.message: I would guess 'Search' turns into 'Stop' once you've clicked it, at least that's what I would expect. Awesome work Aurélien, much appreciated.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
"Close" button is there just like "Cancel" is there on many dialogs, even if you can cancel them with the window close button.
The "Search" button turns into "Stop" when search is running.

replies.author: blackpaw
replies.message: Yah, much easier to see and click the [Close] button than the rather small window [x]. I'm presuming "Esc" works as well.

replies.author: Anand Radhakrishnan
replies.message:
"Maybe you can place the "Search" and "Stop" button on the left side of the "Clear" Button." +1 on this.

Glad that someone is work on finer aspects on KMail.

Guessing "Clear" clears search results as well apart from clearing the search fields.

If user is using mouse, he needs to navigate a bit to get to search after typing the search keywords.
Also instead of Match all or any, does it make sense to have "and" "or" operators against each row?

Perhaps, is it good idea to have "Status bar" which shows "Searching - X Number of messages found" while searching and after search ""Done - - X Number of messages found".

A note aside - Is the search based on Nepomuk?

http://www.blogcdn.com/www.... - GMail search is pretty intuitive and very interactive though not advanced.

author: Ernesto Manríquez
message:

author: eliasp
message:
I'm confused about this "fix": It no longer leaves the previous folder selected as it used to sometimes do.

That's what I liked about it: e.g. when going through my mails to archive them, not having to filter for the "Archive" folder each time again but simply typing "m, return".

replies.author: eliasp
replies.message: BTW: There's also this related bug: https://bugs.kde.org/show_b...

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
I am going to look at it, it looks fixed now, but it's late so I may be missing something :)

By the way, this different bug you mention there: https://bugs.kde.org/show_b... is definitely fixed.

replies.author: eliasp
replies.message: Awesome! Thanks a lot for your efforts! They're very appreciated.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
Oh no, don't worry, this feature still works (fortunately, it is super handy). I did not express myself clearly.

What I meant is that in 4.10 something like this can happen:
- Start KMail, Inbox is selected by default
- Immediatly press J to jump to another folder, select folder "foo"
- "foo" gets selected, but "Inbox" is not unselected
